intro: Achyronia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf achyronia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round fruits. Achyronia longifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or thickets.
